snippet: The company's online music brand, iHeartRadio, attracted advertising that helped offset losses from more traditional kinds of broadcasting. Yet it also weighed down what otherwise would have been savings on the terrestrial radio side.
abstract: The company's online music brand, iHeartRadio, attracted advertising that helped offset losses from more traditional kinds of broadcasting. Yet it also weighed down what otherwise would have been savings on the terrestrial radio side.

headline.main: So Far, Clear Channel's Digital Strategy Is Breaking Even
